meanings.definition: To utter a loud, mournful cry or howl.
meanings.sent1: The lonely wolf behowled in the dark forest.
meanings.sent2: The dog behowled when its owner left the house.
meanings.sent3: The beagle behowled at the mailman, thinking he was a new friend.
meanings.sent4: The wind behowled through the trees, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure behowled in the haunted mansion, scaring the visitors.

meanings.definition: To cry out loudly or vehemently.
meanings.sent1: The singer behowled the high notes during the concert.
meanings.sent2: The protestors behowled their demands outside the government building.
meanings.sent3: The toddler behowled for more cookies, making a scene in the grocery store.
meanings.sent4: The storm behowled outside, matching the anger in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The warrior behowled his battle cry before charging into the enemy lines.
